Key Match Events: Christian Bethancourt delivered a bases-loaded single with two outs in the ninth to give the Cubs an 11-10 lead
Bethancourt ripped a two-run homer in the seventh to cut the deficit to five runs
Bethancourt pulled a double down the left-field line to drive in two more in the eighth
Bethancourt had an RBI groundout earlier in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell emphasized staying in the fight and not giving in
The Cubs were trying to find a way to get back into the wild-card race
Post-Match Reflections: Counsell highlighted the team's resilience after the comeback win
Ian Happ expressed confidence in the team's ability to continue stringing together good offensive performances
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs trailed 10-3 after six innings but scored 11 runs in the final three frames
Christian Bethancourt made his eighth start with the Cubs since being called up in late July
Paired with Miguel Amaya, the catching duo has been the most productive in baseball over the last month
